intro: Maesa ambrymensis, commonly known as the Ambrym maesa, is a flowering plant native to the island of Ambrym in Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
